metadata.Title: CVE-2018-8012 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: No authentication/authorization is enforced when a server attempts to join a quorum in Apache ZooKeeper before 3.4.10, and 3.5.0-alpha through 3.5.3-beta. As a result an arbitrary end point could join the cluster and begin propagating counterfeit changes to the leader. It was discovered that Apache Zookeeper incorrectly handled clusters. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information.

notes.Note: msalvatore> Debian notes that for wheezy (3.4.5) the "changes are too intrusive to backport"

criterions.comment: zookeeper package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
